name: Generator
comment:
This class allows to generate a new version of gh-pages. You can choose what you want to put in gh-pages : examples, dartdoc, docs and/or custom files.

As sample here's how the gh-pages for this package is generated :

new gh.Generator()
..setDartDoc(['lib/ghpages_generator.dart'], excludedLibs: ['path'])
..templateDir = 'gh-pages-template'
..generate();

templateDir=.name: templateDir=
templateDir=.comment: Indicates a template directory from which all files will be paste in gh-pages.

withDocs=.name: withDocs=
withDocs=.comment: Specify that the docs directory have to be paste in gh-pages.

withWeb=.name: withWeb=
withWeb=.comment: Specify that the web directory have to be paste in gh-pages.

workDir.name: workDir
workDir.comment: The directory use to build the gh-pages branch.

constructors.comment: Create a ghpages_generator/ghpages_generator.Generator based on the current directory where script is launch. You can customize the name of the directory with the ghpages_generator/ghpages_generator.Generator.Generator-.rootDir named parameter.

generate.name: generate
generate.comment: Generate gh-pages. A ghpages_generator/ghpages_generator.Generator.generate.doCustomTask method can be set to perform custom operations just before committing files.

setDartDoc.name: setDartDoc
setDartDoc.comment:
Specify that dartDoc have to be generated for the given ghpages_generator/ghpages_generator.Generator.setDartDoc.files using the docgen command line tool.

Options can be set through the named parameters. By default, dartDoc is generated in docs/dartdoc.

setExamples.name: setExamples
setExamples.comment: Specify that examples have to be compiled and included in gh-pages. If ghpages_generator/ghpages_generator.Generator.setExamples.compileDart is false the generated dart files (get with pub build) will be replace by the original ones from examples.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides ghpages_generator/ghpages_generator.Generator.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and ghpages_generator/ghpages_generator.Generator.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the ghpages_generator/ghpages_generator.Generator.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
ghpages_generator/ghpages_generator.Generator.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to ghpages_generator/ghpages_generator.Generator.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If ghpages_generator/ghpages_generator.Generator.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of ghpages_generator/ghpages_generator.Generator.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.
